abstract: New York Attorney General Andrew Cuomo’s threat of legal action against American International Group, unless its moves to recover bonuses and other payments from its former executives, had shades of former N.Y. A.G. Eliot Spitzer, whose sweeping attacks on Wall Street ended in a high-profile, industry-wide settlement, The New York Times’s Jonathan D. Glater and Vikas Bajaj reported.
lead_paragraph: New York Attorney General Andrew Cuomo’s threat of legal action against American International Group, unless its moves to recover bonuses and other payments from its former executives, had shades of former N.Y. A.G. Eliot Spitzer, whose sweeping attacks on Wall Street ended in a high-profile, industry-wide settlement, The New York Times’s Jonathan D. Glater and Vikas Bajaj reported.

headline.main: Does Cuomo Have a Case Against A.I.G.?
